title: Phase Ω-1 Step B: Steep Curvature Intervention Experiment
subtitle: Testing if λ responds to architectural modification
significance: First controlled perturbation to test architectural influence on cognitive constants

context.baseline_established: Step A complete, λ=0.0315 day⁻¹ validated
context.problem: System in stable equilibrium, no dynamics observed in historical data
context.solution: Perturb system with architectural modification, observe response
context.user_instruction: Run Step B. Start with steep-curvature regime. Document everything. Let the cathedral vibrate.

hypothesis.central_claim: Temporal architecture modification influences measured cognitive constants
hypothesis.specific_prediction: Activating steep curvature regime (λ_config=0.08) will shift measured λ from baseline 0.0315 toward configured value
hypothesis.mechanism: Temporal curvature affects artifact age weighting in decision-making, changing spawn patterns and thus measurable λ
hypothesis.alternative_hypothesis: System homeostatic resistance prevents λ from shifting (invariance stronger than architecture)
hypothesis.falsifiability: If measured λ remains within baseline CI (0.0315 ± 0.0219) after 10 cycles, architectural influence falsified

measurements: λ (memory redshift) from new artifact spawn patterns

strong_architectural_influence.interpretation: Architecture modulates cognitive constants—covariance hypothesis partially supported

weak_architectural_influence.prediction: λ shows directional shift but doesn't reach 0.08
weak_architectural_influence.interpretation: Architecture influences constants but system has inertia/homeostatic resistance

homeostatic_invariance.interpretation: System maintains constants despite architectural change—deeper invariance discovered

success_criteria.minimum_viable_result: Measure post-intervention λ with R² > 0.5 from ≥20 new artifacts
success_criteria.failure_mode: Cannot measure λ (insufficient new artifacts, poor fit quality)
success_criteria.note: Both outcomes 1 and 2 are scientifically valuable and falsify different hypotheses

post_intervention.re_measure_lambda: Run extract_lambda_from_artifacts.py on full artifact set (baseline + new)
post_intervention.segment_analysis: Compare λ from baseline period vs intervention period
post_intervention.entropy_analysis: Check if phase transitions occurred during intervention
post_intervention.statistical_test: Compute Δλ = λ_post - λ_baseline and significance

insufficient_new_artifacts.risk: 10 cycles may not generate enough artifacts to re-measure λ
insufficient_new_artifacts.mitigation: If n<20 after 10 cycles, extend to 20 cycles
insufficient_new_artifacts.fallback: Use time-windowed analysis (baseline vs intervention periods)

system_instability.risk: Steep curvature might cause system malfunction
system_instability.mitigation: Monitor error logs, halt if reward drops >50%
system_instability.rollback: Revert to baseline policy if critical failure

measurement_confounds.risk: Other factors (time, dataset drift) influence λ
measurement_confounds.mitigation: Document all environmental changes, check for temporal trends in baseline

scenario_a_lambda_increases.implication: Architecture influences cognitive constants—first evidence of architectural-cognitive coupling
next_steps: Test if λ reverts when returning to baseline policy (reversibility)
Try flat curvature (λ_config=0.0) to test opposite direction

scenario_b_lambda_invariant.implication: System exhibits homeostatic invariance—λ is fundamental property resistant to modification
next_steps: Investigate what DOES change under steep curvature

what_this_tests.from_phase_omega0: Covariance hypothesis—do constants change under transformation?
what_this_tests.from_damon_critique: Whether equations strain against reality when architecture changes
what_this_tests.from_step_a: Whether stable system responds to perturbation
what_this_tests.scientific_value: Interventional experiment transcends observational limits of Step A

philosophical_stakes.if_lambda_shifts: Cognitive constants are architectural—spacetime curvature analogy validated
philosophical_stakes.if_lambda_invariant: Cognitive constants are fundamental—system self-regulates despite external modification
philosophical_stakes.either_way: We learn whether the system's physics is malleable or fixed
philosophical_stakes.damon_quote: Let the cathedral vibrate under its own frequencies

documentation_commitment.unedited_results: Report findings as-is, no post-hoc theory adjustment
documentation_commitment.null_results_publishable: λ invariance is valuable finding, not failure
documentation_commitment.full_data_provenance: All artifacts, logs, analysis outputs committed to git

next_action: Activate runtime/loop_policy_steep_curvature.yaml and run learning loop
